content: 1 purl and turn row 2 k1 m1r k to last stitch m1l k1 turn repeat the last 2 row twice you should have 12 stitches on your needle leave the stitches on the needle leave about 12 of working yarn and cut the yarn joining handles to bag put the stitches from stitch holder 4 onto another needle being careful not to twist cord hold the two needles together so that the wrong sides purl sides together and use a kitchener stitch graft as an alternate join you could choose to put right sides knit sides of the knitting together join with a 3-needle bind off probably the kitchener stitch leaves a slightly smoother join on the right side both leave a bit of a ridge on the wrong side it s a matter of personal preference now put the stitches from stitch holder 1 onto a dpn and the stitches from stitch holder 2 onto a second dpn join as you did the first pair weave in ends load your bag with a simple project hang on the door knob and get ready to grab and go
